 39
 40/// Reference Counting Policies.
 41///
 42/// A reference counting policy describes which behavior should be
 43/// taken when an DDI class creates and destroys references to a block. 
 44///
 45/// A policy should implement two static functions:
 46///  - inc() - action to perform when reference is created 
 47///  - dec() - action to perform when reference is destroyed 
 48///
 49///
 50/// The following policies are available:
 51///
 52///  - No_count_policy: do not increment/decrement block reference count.
 53///
 54///    When a DDI class is used in the same scope as another reference
 55///    to the block being accessed, it is not necessary to increment
 56///    the reference count.
 57///
 58///  - Ref_count_policy: increment/decrement block reference count.
 59///
 60///    When a DDI class is used in a situation where the block it
 61///    references does not have a guarenteed reference.
 62
 63
 64/// No reference count policy, indicates DDI object will not increment
 65/// and decrement reference count.
 66struct No_count_policy
 67{
 68  template <typename Block>
 69  static void inc(Block const* /* block */) {}
 70
 71  template <typename Block>
 72  static void dec(Block const* /* block */) {}
 73};
 74
 75
 76
 77/// Reference count policy, indicates DDI object will increment and
 78/// decrement reference count.
 79struct Ref_count_policy
 80{
 81  template <typename Block>
 82  static void inc(Block const* block) { block->increment_count(); }
 83
 84  template <typename Block>
 85  static void dec(Block const* block) { block->decrement_count(); }
 86};
 87
 88
 89
 90/// Namespace for low-level data access interfaces.  These interfaces
 91/// provide low-level data access to data stored within blocks
 92/// (directly or indirectly).
 93///
 94/// These interfaces are not intended to be used in application code,
 95/// or in the library implementation outside of the Ext_data class.
 96/// Not all low-level interfaces are valid for all blocks, and over time
 97/// details of the low-level interface may change.  To provide a
 98/// consistent data interface to all blocks, the Ext_data class should
 99/// be used instead.
100namespace data_access 
101{
102
103/// Specialization for low-level direct data access.
104///
105/// Template parameters:
106///   BLOCK to be a block that supports direct access via member
107///     functions impl_data() and impl_stride().  Access to these
108///     members can be protected by making Low_level_data_access a friend
109///     class to the block.
110///   LP is a layout policy describing the desired layout.  It is should
111///     match the inherent layout of the block.  Specifying a layout
112///     not directly supported by the block is an error and results in
113///     undefined behavior.
114template <typename Block,
115	  typename LP>
116class Low_level_data_access<Direct_access_tag, Block, LP>
117{
118  // Compile time typedefs.
119public:
120  static dimension_type const dim = LP::dim;
121
122  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
123  typedef typename LP::order_type    order_type;
124  typedef typename LP::pack_type     pack_type;
125  typedef typename LP::complex_type  complex_type;
126
127  typedef Storage<complex_type, value_type> storage_type;
128  typedef typename storage_type::type       raw_ptr_type;
129  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_raw_ptr_type;
130
131  // Compile- and run-time properties.
132public:
133  static int   const CT_Cost         = 0;
134  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req  = true;
135  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req = true;
136
137  static int    cost         (Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
138    { return CT_Cost; }
139  static size_t mem_required (Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
140    { return 0; }
141  static size_t xfer_required(Block const& /*block*/, LP const& /*layout*/)
142    { return !CT_Xfer_not_req; }
143
144  // Constructor and destructor.
145public:
146  Low_level_data_access(Block&,
147			raw_ptr_type     = NULL)
148  {}
149
150  ~Low_level_data_access() {}
151
152  void begin(Block*, bool) {}
153  void end(Block*, bool) {}
154
155  int cost() const { return CT_Cost; }
156
157  // Direct data acessors.
158public:
159  raw_ptr_type data(Block * blk) const
160  { return blk->impl_data();}
161  stride_type	stride(Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
162    { return blk->impl_stride(dim, d); }
163  length_type	size  (Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
164    { return blk->size(dim, d); }
165  length_type	size  (Block* blk) const
166    { return blk->size(); }
167};
168
169
170
171/// Specialization for copied direct data access.
172///
173/// Template parameters:
174///   :Block: to be a block.
175///   :LP:    is a layout policy describing the desired layout.
176///           The desired layout can be different from the block's layout.
177///
178/// Notes:
179///   When the desired layout packing format is either Stride_unit or
180///   Stride_unknown, the packing format used will be Stride_unit_dense.
181template <typename Block,
182	  typename LP>
183class Low_level_data_access<Copy_access_tag, Block, LP>
184{
185  // Compile time typedefs.
186public:
187  static dimension_type const dim = LP::dim;
188
189  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
190  typedef typename LP::order_type    order_type;
191  typedef typename
192          ITE_Type<Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unit>::value ||
193	           Type_equal<typename LP::pack_type, Stride_unknown>::value,
194                   As_type<Stride_unit_dense>,
195		   As_type<typename LP::pack_type> >::type pack_type;
196  typedef typename LP::complex_type  complex_type;
197
198  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> actual_layout_type;
199
200  typedef Allocated_storage<complex_type, value_type> storage_type;
201  typedef typename storage_type::type                 raw_ptr_type;
202  typedef typename storage_type::const_type           const_raw_ptr_type;
203
204  // Compile- and run-time properties.
205public:
206  static int   const CT_Cost          = 2;
207  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req   = false;
208  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req  = false;
209
210  static int    cost(Block const&, LP const&)
211    { return CT_Cost; }
212  static size_t mem_required (Block const& block, LP const&)
213    { return sizeof(typename Block::value_type) * block.size(); }
214  static size_t xfer_required(Block const&, LP const&)
215    { return !CT_Xfer_not_req; }
216
217  // Constructor and destructor.
218public:
219  Low_level_data_access(Block&         blk,
220			raw_ptr_type   buffer = NULL)
221    : layout_   (extent<dim>(blk)),
222      storage_  (layout_.total_size(), buffer)
223  {}
224
225  ~Low_level_data_access()
226    { storage_.deallocate(layout_.total_size()); }
227
228  void begin(Block* blk, bool sync)
229  {
230    if (sync)
231      Block_copy_to_ptr<LP::dim, Block, order_type, pack_type, complex_type>::
232	copy(blk, layout_, storage_.data());
233  }
234
235  void end(Block* blk, bool sync)
236  {
237    if (sync)
238      Block_copy_from_ptr<LP::dim, Block, order_type, pack_type, complex_type>::
239	copy(blk, layout_, storage_.data());
240  }
241
242  int cost() const { return CT_Cost; }
243
244  // Direct data acessors.
245public:
246  raw_ptr_type	data(Block*)
247    { return storage_.data(); }
248  const_raw_ptr_type	data(Block*) const
249    { return storage_.data(); }
250  stride_type	stride(Block*, dimension_type d) const
251    { return layout_.stride(d); }
252  length_type	size  (Block* blk, dimension_type d) const
253    { return blk->size(Block::dim, d); }
254  length_type	size  (Block* blk) const
255    { return blk->size(); }
256
257  // Member data.
258private:
259  Applied_layout<actual_layout_type> layout_;
260  storage_type                       storage_;
261};
262
263
264
265template <> struct Cost<Direct_access_tag>   { static int const value = 0; };
266template <> struct Cost<Copy_access_tag>     { static int const value = 2; };
267
268} // namespace vsip::impl::data_access
269
270
271
272/// Choose access type for a given block and desired layout.
273
274#if VSIP_IMPL_REF_IMPL
275template <typename Block,
276	  typename LP>
277struct Choose_access
278{
279  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::layout_type BLP;
280  typedef typename Block_layout<Block>::access_type access_type;
281
282  typedef typename 
283    ITE_Type<Type_equal<BLP, LP>::value,
284	   As_type<access_type>, As_type<Copy_access_tag> >::type
285    type;
286};
287#endif
288
289
290
291/// Determine desired block layout.
292///
293/// For a block with direct access, the desired layout is the same
294/// as the block's layout (Block_layout).
295///
296/// For a block with copy access, the desired layout adjusts the
297/// pack type to be dense, so that the block can be copied into
298/// contiguous memory.
299template <typename BlockT>
300struct Desired_block_layout
301{
302private:
303  typedef Block_layout<BlockT> raw_type;
304
305public:
306  static dimension_type const dim = raw_type::dim;
307
308  typedef typename raw_type::access_type   access_type;
309  typedef typename raw_type::order_type    order_type;
310  typedef typename
311	  ITE_Type<Type_equal<access_type, Direct_access_tag>::value,
312		   As_type<typename raw_type::pack_type>,
313	  ITE_Type<Type_equal<access_type, Copy_access_tag>::value &&
314                   Is_stride_unit_align<typename raw_type::pack_type>::value,
315		      As_type<typename raw_type::pack_type>,
316		      As_type<Stride_unit_dense>
317	          > >::type                  pack_type;
318  typedef typename raw_type::complex_type  complex_type;
319
320  typedef Layout<dim, order_type, pack_type, complex_type> layout_type;
321};
322
323
324
325/// High-level data access class.  Provides data access to data
326/// stored in blocks, using an appropriate low-level data interface.
327///
328/// Template parameters:
329///
330///   :BlockT: is a block type.
331///   :LP:     is the desired layout policy for the data access.
332///   :RP:     is a reference counting policy.
333///   :AT:     is a data access tag that selects the low-level interface
334///            used to access the data.  By default, Choose_access is used to
335///            select the appropriate access tag for a given block type
336///            `BlockT` and layout `LP`.
337///
338/// Notes:
339///   Selecting a specific low-level interface is discouraged.
340///   Selecting one that is not compatible with BLOCK will result in
341///   undefined behavior.
342template <typename BlockT,
343	  typename LP  = typename Desired_block_layout<BlockT>::layout_type,
344	  typename RP  = No_count_policy,
345	  typename AT  = typename Choose_access<BlockT, LP>::type>
346class Ext_data : Assert_proper_block<BlockT>
347{
348  // Compile time typedefs.
349public:
350  typedef typename Non_const_of<BlockT>::type non_const_block_type;
351
352  typedef data_access::Low_level_data_access<AT, BlockT, LP> ext_type;
353  typedef typename BlockT::value_type value_type;
354
355  typedef Storage<typename LP::complex_type, typename BlockT::value_type>
356		storage_type;
357
358  typedef typename storage_type::alloc_type element_type;
359  typedef typename storage_type::type       raw_ptr_type;
360  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_raw_ptr_type;
361
362
363  // Compile- and run-time properties.
364public:
365  static int   const CT_Cost          = ext_type::CT_Cost;
366  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req   = ext_type::CT_Mem_not_req;
367  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req  = ext_type::CT_Xfer_not_req;
368
369
370  // Constructor and destructor.
371public:
372  Ext_data(non_const_block_type& block,
373	   sync_action_type      sync   = SYNC_INOUT,
374	   raw_ptr_type          buffer = storage_type::null())
375    : blk_ (&block),
376      ext_ (block, buffer),
377      sync_(sync)
378    { ext_.begin(blk_.get(), sync_ & SYNC_IN); }
379
380  Ext_data(BlockT const&      block,
381	   sync_action_type   sync   = SYNC_IN,
382	   raw_ptr_type       buffer = storage_type::null())
383    : blk_ (&const_cast<BlockT&>(block)),
384      ext_ (const_cast<BlockT&>(block), buffer),
385      sync_(sync)
386  {
387    assert(sync != SYNC_OUT && sync != SYNC_INOUT);
388    ext_.begin(blk_.get(), sync_ & SYNC_IN);
389  }
390
391  ~Ext_data()
392    { ext_.end(blk_.get(), sync_ & SYNC_OUT); }
393
394  // Direct data acessors.
395public:
396  raw_ptr_type data()
397    { return ext_.data  (blk_.get()); }
398
399  const_raw_ptr_type data() const
400    { return ext_.data  (blk_.get()); }
401
402  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const
403    { return ext_.stride(blk_.get(), d); }
404
405  length_type size(dimension_type d) const
406    { return ext_.size  (blk_.get(), d); }
407
408  length_type size() const
409    { return ext_.size  (blk_.get()); }
410
411  int cost() const
412    { return ext_.cost(); }
413
414  // Member data.
415private:
416  typename View_block_storage<BlockT>::template With_rp<RP>::type
417		   blk_;
418  ext_type         ext_;
419  sync_action_type sync_;
420};
421
422
423template <typename Block,
424	  typename LP  = typename Desired_block_layout<Block>::layout_type,
425	  typename RP  = No_count_policy,
426	  typename AT  = typename Choose_access<Block, LP>::type>
427class Persistent_ext_data : Assert_proper_block<Block>
428{
429  // Compile time typedefs.
430public:
431  typedef data_access::Low_level_data_access<AT, Block, LP> ext_type;
432  typedef typename Block::value_type value_type;
433
434  typedef Storage<typename LP::complex_type, typename Block::value_type>
435		storage_type;
436
437  typedef typename storage_type::alloc_type element_type;
438  typedef typename storage_type::type       raw_ptr_type;
439  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_raw_ptr_type;
440
441
442  // Compile- and run-time properties.
443public:
444  static int   const CT_Cost          = ext_type::CT_Cost;
445  static bool  const CT_Mem_not_req   = ext_type::CT_Mem_not_req;
446  static bool  const CT_Xfer_not_req  = ext_type::CT_Xfer_not_req;
447
448
449  // Constructor and destructor.
450public:
451  Persistent_ext_data(Block&             block,
452		      sync_action_type   sync   = SYNC_INOUT,
453		      raw_ptr_type       buffer = storage_type::null())
454    : blk_ (&block),
455      ext_ (block, buffer),
456      sync_(sync)
457    {}
458
459  ~Persistent_ext_data()
460    {}
461
462  void begin()
463    { ext_.begin(blk_.get(), sync_ & SYNC_IN); }
464
465  void end()
466    { ext_.end(blk_.get(), sync_ & SYNC_OUT); }
467
468  // Direct data acessors.
469public:
470  raw_ptr_type data()
471    { return ext_.data  (blk_.get()); }
472
473  const_raw_ptr_type data() const
474    { return ext_.data  (blk_.get()); }
475
476  stride_type stride(dimension_type d) const
477    { return ext_.stride(blk_.get(), d); }
478
479  length_type size(dimension_type d) const
480    { return ext_.size  (blk_.get(), d); }
481
482  int cost() const
483    { return ext_.cost(); }
484
485  // Member data.
486private:
487  typename View_block_storage<Block>::template With_rp<RP>::type
488		   blk_;
489  ext_type         ext_;
490  sync_action_type sync_;
491};
492
493
494
495template <typename Block,
496	  typename LP = typename Desired_block_layout<Block>::layout_type>
497struct Ext_data_cost
498{
499  typedef typename Choose_access<Block, LP>::type access_type;
500  static int const value = data_access::Cost<access_type>::value;
501};
502
503
504
505/***********************************************************************
506  Definitions
507***********************************************************************/
508
509/// Return the cost of accessing a block with a given layout.
510template <typename LP,
511	  typename Block>
512inline 
513int
514cost(
515  Block const& block,
516  LP    const& layout = LP())
517{
518  typedef typename Choose_access<Block, LP>::type
519		access_type;
520
521  return data_access::Low_level_data_access<access_type, Block, LP>
522    ::cost(block, layout);
523}
524
525
526
527/// Return the number of bytes of memory required to access a block
528/// with a given layout.
529template <typename LP,
530	  typename Block>
531size_t
532mem_required(
533  Block const& block,
534  LP    const& layout = LP())
535{
536  typedef typename Choose_access<Block, LP>::type
537		access_type;
538
539  return data_access::Low_level_data_access<access_type, Block, LP>
540    ::mem_required(block, layout);
541}
542
543
544
545/// Return whether a transfer is required to access a block with
546/// a given layout.
547template <typename LP,
548	  typename Block>
549bool
550xfer_required(
551  Block const& block,
552  LP    const& layout = LP())
553{
554  typedef typename Choose_access<Block, LP>::type
555		access_type;
556
557  return data_access::Low_level_data_access<access_type, Block, LP>
558    ::xfer_required(block, layout);
559}
560
561
562
563/// Determine if an Ext_data object refers to a dense (contiguous,
564/// unit-stride) region of memory.
565template <typename OrderT,
566	  typename ExtT>
567bool
568is_ext_dense(
569  vsip::dimension_type dim,
570  ExtT const&          ext)
571{
572  using vsip::dimension_type;
573  using vsip::stride_type;
574
575  dimension_type const dim0 = OrderT::impl_dim0;
576  dimension_type const dim1 = OrderT::impl_dim1;
577  dimension_type const dim2 = OrderT::impl_dim2;
578
579  assert(dim <= VSIP_MAX_DIMENSION);
580
581  if (dim == 1)
582  {
583    return (ext.stride(dim0) == 1);
584  }
585  else if (dim == 2)
586  {
587    return (ext.stride(dim1) == 1) &&
588           (ext.stride(dim0) == static_cast<stride_type>(ext.size(dim1)) ||
589	    ext.size(dim0) == 1);
590  }
591  else /*  if (dim == 2) */
592  {
593    return (ext.stride(dim2) == 1) &&
594           (ext.stride(dim1) == static_cast<stride_type>(ext.size(dim2)) ||
595	    (ext.size(dim0) == 1 && ext.size(dim1) == 1)) &&
596           (ext.stride(dim0) == static_cast<stride_type>(ext.size(dim1)  *
597							 ext.size(dim2)) ||
598	    ext.size(dim0) == 1);
599  }
600}
601
602} // namespace vsip::impl
603} // namespace vsip
